Test Name: Bacterial Culture, Cystic Fibrosis with Antimicrobial Susceptibilities
Specimen Type: Sputum, bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL), or throat swab
Purpose: To identify bacterial pathogens in cystic fibrosis patients and determine their antimicrobial susceptibilities.
Container: Sterile container for sputum or BAL; bacterial transport medium for throat swabs
Equipment: Class II biological safety cabinet, CO2 incubator (35–37 °C), microscope, culture plates (blood, MacConkey, chocolate agar), automated identification/susceptibility system (e.g., VITEK)
